cs.umass.edu.myactivitiestoolkit.ppg

Class HeartRateCameraView

  • java.lang.Object
    • SurfaceView
      • cs.umass.edu.myactivitiestoolkit.ppg.HeartRateCameraView

  • public class HeartRateCameraView
extends SurfaceView
    The heart rate camera view acquires PPG data from using the phone's camera. It sets up a Camera object with the appropriate parameters, e.g. the preview size and resolution and flash mode, and registers a android.hardware.Camera.PreviewCallback for receiving pixel data each frame. The onPreviewFrame(byte[], Camera) method is called with each frame. The raw data is in NV21 format and is converted already to RGB format for you.

    ASSIGNMENT 4 (PHOTOPLETHYSMOGRAPHY) : In onPreviewFrame(byte[], Camera), you should extract the mean red value from the pixel data and send it to all PPGListeners, maintained in the listeners list. To ensure clean modular design, all PPG processing and heart-beat detection should be done in the PPGListener.onSensorChanged(PPGEvent) event, which you override in the PPGService. Do NOT call your heart rate detection algorithm from within this class.

    EXTRA CREDIT: The Camera class is deprecated after API level 21 (Lollipop) and may not be fully supported in future APIs. Instead, you should use the android.hardware.camera2 API to fully support newer hardware. For extra credit, re-implement the Photoplethysmography sensor using the camera2 API.
    See Also:
    Camera, android.hardware.Camera.PreviewCallback#onPreviewFrame(byte[], Camera), PPGEvent, PPGListener, SurfaceView

    • Method Detail

      • setSurfaceCreatedCallback

        public void setSurfaceCreatedCallback(HeartRateCameraView.SurfaceCreatedCallback surfaceCreatedCallback)
        Registers a callback to listen for the event that the surface is created. This is important to ensure that no application component calls start() on a HeartRateCameraView instance that has not yet been completely initialized.
        Parameters:
        surfaceCreatedCallback - the callback implementation.

      • registerListener

        public void registerListener(PPGListener listener)
        Registers a client to listen for PPG sensor events.
        Parameters:
        listener - a listener implementation.

      • unregisterListener

        public void unregisterListener(PPGListener listener)
        Unregisters the specified listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - the reference to the listener to be unregistered.

      • unregisterListeners

        public void unregisterListeners()
        Unregisters all PPG sensor event listeners. No sensor events will be relayed to any other application components as long as there are no registered listeners.

      • surfaceChanged

        public void surfaceChanged(SurfaceHolder holder,
                           int format,
                           int width,
                           int height)

      • surfaceCreated

        public void surfaceCreated(SurfaceHolder holder)

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the camera preview for collecting PPG data. This MUST be called after surfaceCreated(SurfaceHolder) has been called or mCamera will be null and a NullPointerException will be thrown. It is not guaranteed that the surface will be created before calling this method; therefore, make sure to register a HeartRateCameraView.SurfaceCreatedCallback to be notified.

      • initializeCamera

        public void initializeCamera()
        Initializes the handle to the camera object by requesting use of the hardware camera and sets the camera parameters appropriately.

      • surfaceDestroyed

        public void surfaceDestroyed(SurfaceHolder holder)

      • onPreviewFrame

        public void onPreviewFrame(byte[] data,
                           Camera camera)
        Called when each frame is captured by the camera. We already decode the data to RGB pixels for you. Your job is to compute the mean red value of each frame and send that data to each PPGListener in listeners. You can use the Color#red(int) method to extract the amount of red from an RGB value.

        For better results, try averaging only over a portion of the image about its center. You might try a radial or rectangular region.
        Parameters:
        data - the data, by default in NV21 (YUV420SP) image format.
        camera - a handle to the camera object.
        See Also:
        android.graphics.ImageFormat#NV21

      • setSize

        public void setSize(int width,
                    int height)
        Sets the size of the camera preview surface holder. Note this does not change the resolution of the preview.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the surface holder.
        height - the height of the surface holder.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the camera recording and releases the camera for other applications to use.
